newsitem.title: UK: RUGBY LEAGUE-WIGAN TO SELL GROUND IN MULTI-MILLION DEAL.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY LEAGUE-WIGAN TO SELL GROUND IN MULTI-MILLION DEAL.

text.p: Top English side Wigan insisted on Wednesday they will soon be the richest rugby league club in the world after announcing the sale of their ground to a supermarket chain.
The club, whose financial problems have deepened over the past year, have agreed a deal worth over 12 million pounds ($19.3 million) and will abandon their Central Park home in two years time.

"It's a phenomenal deal which will make us the richest rugby league club in the world.," said Wigan chairman Jack Robinson, who hopes to use the money to build a new state-of-the-art stadium in the town.
A rival bidder, who wants the rugby league club to share Central Park with the local soccer team, is threatening legal action over the decision.
